p: However, BDV or a BDV-like agent are not only endogenized, but also induce exogenous infections with associated diseases. Borna disease of horses is a long-known disease in central Europe, but is nowadays also occurring elsewhere, and occurs in several other vertebrates, for example the sheep, rabbit, dog, cat, and cow [1]. Instead of or in addition to an exogenous BDV infection, what cannot be excluded is whether possible human BDV-related symptoms [4] are linked to endogenous Borna-like sequences (EBL). The role of EBLs in human disease is unknown, and hypotheses exist as to both a protective role for them and a pathogenic function [13], [14].
